alert.note: Alert for District of Columbia (District of Columbia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 25 at 12:56PM EDT until July 25 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM EDT FOR THE SOUTHEASTERN DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND CENTRAL PRINCE GEORGES COUNTIES... At 1256 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Walker Mill, or over Forestville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Forestville, Largo, Coral Hills, Fedex Field, Andrews Air Force Base, Camp Springs, Kettering, Walker Mill, Mitchellville, Rosaryville, Lake Arbor, Marlow Heights, Seat Pleasant, Carmody Hills-Pepper Mill Village, District Heights, Capitol Heights, Morningside, Fairmount Heights and Suitland-Silver Hill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
